pullRequest.body:
This PR defines t-structures on (pre)triangulated categories.

---

```suggestion @Book{ bbd-1982, author = {Beilinson, A. A. and Bernstein, J. and Deligne, P. and Gabber, O.}, title = {Analyse et topologie sur les espaces singuliers. {I : Faisceaux pervers}}, ```

**[lint-bib]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion booktitle = {Proceedings of the colloquium held at {L}uminy, {J}uly 6--11, 1981}, ```

**[lint-bib]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion booktitle = {Proceedings of the colloquium held at {L}uminy, {J}uly 6--11, 1981}, ```

```suggestion
* define functors `t.truncLE n : C â¥¤ C`,`t.truncGE n : C â¥¤ C` and the
  associated distinguished triangles
* promote these truncations to a (functorial) spectral object
* define the heart of `t` and show it is an abelian category
* define triangulated subcategories `t.plus`, `t.minus`, `t.bounded` and show
  that there are induced t-structures on these full subcategories
```
Is it possible to obtain this proof from `LE_monotone` via the opposite category?

Thanks for the suggestion! I wish I could, but the opposite `t`-structure is not so easy to define. `LE n` in the opposite category corresponds to `GE (-n)` in the original category, etc. Then, it seems that in order to show `LE_zero_le` and `GE_one_le` for the opposite category, we would basically need to know both `LE_monotone` and `GE_antitone` in a few cases for the original category...

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Triangulated): t-structures

source.title: feat/refactor: redefinition of homology + derived categories
